formalDefinition:
Given two groups, $(G, ∗)$ and $(H, ·)$, a group homomorphism from $(G, ∗)$ to $(H, ·)$ is a function $h : G \to H$ such that for all u and v in G it holds that
$$h(u*v)=h(u)  \cdot h(v) $$ 

where the group operation on the left hand side of the equation is that of $G$ and on the right hand side that of $H$.
